pym.cache module¶

class pym.cache.CachingQuery(regions, *args, **kw)¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.orm.query.Query

A Query subclass which optionally loads full results from a dogpile cache region.

The CachingQuery optionally stores additional state that allows it to consult a dogpile.cache cache before accessing the database, in the form of a FromCache or RelationshipCache object. Each of these objects refer to the name of a dogpile.cache.Region that’s been configured and stored in a lookup dictionary. When such an object has associated itself with the CachingQuery, the corresponding dogpile.cache.Region is used to locate a cached result. If none is present, then the Query is invoked normally, the results being cached.

The FromCache and RelationshipCache mapper options below represent the “public” method of configuring this state upon the CachingQuery.

get_value(merge=True, createfunc=None, expiration_time=None, ignore_expiration=False)¶

Return the value from the cache for this query.

Raise KeyError if no value present and no createfunc specified.

invalidate()¶

Invalidate the cache value represented by this Query.

set_value(value)¶

Set the value in the cache for this query.

class pym.cache.FromCache(region='default', cache_key=None)¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.orm.interfaces.MapperOption

Specifies that a Query should load results from a cache.

process_query(query)¶

Process a Query during normal loading operation.

propagate_to_loaders = False¶
class pym.cache.RelationshipCache(attribute, region='default', cache_key=None)¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.orm.interfaces.MapperOption

Specifies that a Query as called within a “lazy load” should load results from a cache.

and_(option)¶

Chain another RelationshipCache option to this one.

While many RelationshipCache objects can be specified on a single Query separately, chaining them together allows for a more efficient lookup during load.

process_query_conditionally(query)¶

Process a Query that is used within a lazy loader.

(the process_query_conditionally() method is a SQLAlchemy hook invoked only within lazyload.)

propagate_to_loaders = True¶
